title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 46 (Slavery 4
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 46 (Slavery 4):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Archer (Ed.) - Slavery and Other Forms of Unfree Labour (1988)

-  Baptist - The Half Has Never Been Told; Slavery and the Making of American Capitalism (2014)

-  Baum - Shrines of the Slave Trade (1999)

-  Curtin - The Rise and Fall of the Plantation Complex; Essays in Atlantic History, 2e (1998)

-  Davis - The Problem of Slavery in the Age of Emancipation (2014)

-  Davis & Gates (Eds.) - The Slave's Narrative (1985)

-  Falola & Warnock (Eds.) - Encyclopedia of the Middle Passage (2007)

-  Fiske et al - Solomon Northup; the Complete Story of the Author of Twelve Years a Slave (2013)

-  Flax - Resonances of Slavery in Race-Gender Relations; Shadow at the Hearth of American Politics (2010)

-  Foote - Black and White Manhattan; The History of Racial Formation in Colonial New York City (2004)

-  Gates & Andrews - Pioneers of the Black Atlantic; Five Slave Narratives from the Enlightenment, 1772-1815 (1998)

-  Goldstone - Dark Bargain; Slavery, Profits, and the Struggle for the Constitution (2005)

-  Grandin - The Empire of Necessity; Slavery, Freedom, and Deception in the New World (2014)

-  Higman - Plantation Jamaica, 1750-1850; Capital and Control in a Colonial Economy (2008)

-  Hogendorn & Johnson - The Shell Money of the Slave Trade (1986)

-  Horne - The Counter-Revolution of 1776; Slave Resistance and the Origins of the United States of America (2014)

-  Johnson - River of Dark Dreams; Slavery and Empire in the Cotton Kingdom (2013)

-  Katz-Hyman & Rice (Eds.) - World of a Slave; Encyclopedia of the Material Life of Slaves in the United States (2011)

-  Kershnar - Justice for the Past (2004)

-  Klein - Historical Dictionary of Slavery and Abolition, 2e (2014)

-  Libby et al (Eds.) - Affect and Power; Essays on Sex, Slavery, Race, and Religion in Appreciation of Winthrop D. Jordan (2005)

-  Litwack - Been in the Storm So Long; the Aftermath of Slavery (1980)

-  Lubet - Fugitive Justice; Runaways, Rescuers, and Slavery on Trial (2010)

-  Martin - Divided Mastery; Slave Hiring in the American South (2004)

-  McElya - Clinging to Mammy; The Faithful Slave in Twentieth-Century America (2007)

-  Murphy - Survivors of Slavery; Modern-Day Slave Narratives (2014)

-  Ortiz - Emancipation Betrayed; The Hidden History of Black Organizing and white Violence in Florida (2005)

-  Oshinsky - Worse Than Slavery; Parchman Farm and the Ordeal of Jim Crow Justice (1996)

-  Ruef - Between Slavery and Capitalism; the Legacy of Emancipation in the American South (2014)

-  Soike - Necessary Courage; Iowa's Underground Railroad in the Struggle Against Slavery (2013)

-  Solow & Engerman (Eds.) - British Capitalism & Caribbean Slavery; the Legacy of Eric Williams (1987)

-  Sundquist - Empire and Slavery in American Literature, 1820-1865 (1995)

-  Wilder - Ebony & Ivy; Race, Slavery, and the Troubled History of American's Universities (2013)

-  Williams - American Slavery; a Very Short Introduction (2014)

-  Woodard - The Delectable Negro; Human Consumption and Homoeroticism within US Slave Culture (2014)
